revised_title: The Fossil Plants of the Coal-Measures: An Examination of the Supposed Radiolarians of the Carboniferous Rocks
tldr: The author examines the fossil plants of the coal-measures, specifically focusing on the supposed radiolarians of the carboniferous rocks. Through analysis of the Arran specimens, the author concludes that these stems were true Lepidodendra and not Sigillaria, providing evidence through the presence of Lepidodendroid twigs, branches, and fruits.
